alertnotify.title: Alert Notification
alertnotify.description: Execute command when an alert is raised (%s in cmd is replaced by message)
alertnotify.shortDescription: Execute command when an alert is raised (%s is replaced by message)

allowignoredconf.title: Allow Ignored Config File
allowignoredconf.description: For backwards compatibility, treat an unused bitcoin.conf file in the datadir as a warning, not an error
allowignoredconf.shortDescription: Treat unused bitcoin.conf file in the datadir as warning, not error

assumevalid.title: Assume Valid Chain History
assumevalid.description: If this block is in the chain assume that it and its ancestors are valid and potentially skip their script verification (0 to verify all)
assumevalid.shortDescription: If this block is in the chain assume that it and its ancestors are valid and potentially skip their script verification

blockfilterindex.title: Block Filter Index
blockfilterindex.description: Maintain an index of compact filters by block. If set to 1, certain indexes are enabled (currently just basic)
blockfilterindex.shortDescription: Maintain an index of compact filters by block

blocknotify.title: Block Notification
blocknotify.description: Execute command when the best block changes (%s in cmd is replaced by block hash)
blocknotify.shortDescription: Execute command when the best block changes (%s is replaced by block hash)

blockreconstructionextratxn.title: Block Reconstruction Transactions
blockreconstructionextratxn.description: Extra transactions to keep in memory for compact block reconstructions

blocksdir.title: Block Data Storage Location
blocksdir.description: Specify directory to hold blocks subdirectory for *.dat files

blocksonly.title: Blocks Only Mode
blocksonly.description: Whether to reject unconfirmed transactions from network peers. Disables automatic broadcast and rebroadcast of transactions, unless the source peer has the 'forcerelay' permission. RPC transactions are not affected
blocksonly.shortDescription: Whether to reject unconfirmed transactions from network peers

blocksxor.title: Block Data XOR
blocksxor.description: Whether an XOR-key applies to blocksdir *.dat files. The created XOR-key will be zeros for an existing blocksdir or when 0 is set, and random for a freshly initialized blocksdir

coinstatsindex.title: Coin Stats Index
coinstatsindex.description: Maintain coinstats index used by the gettxoutsetinfo RPC

confrw.title: Read/Write Config File
confrw.description: Specify path to read/write configuration file. Relative paths will be prefixed by the network-specific datadir location

daemon.title: Daemon Mode
daemon.description: Run in the background as a daemon and accept commands

daemonwait.title: Daemon Wait Mode
daemonwait.description: Wait for initialization to be finished before exiting. This implies daemon mode
daemonwait.shortDescription: Wait for initialization to be finished before exiting

dbbatchsize.title: DB Batch Size
dbbatchsize.description: Maximum database write batch size in bytes

dbcache.title: DB Cache Size
dbcache.description: Maximum database cache size in MiB. In addition, unused mempool memory is shared for this cache (see maxmempool)
dbcache.shortDescription: Maximum database cache size in MiB

dbfilesize.title: DB File Size
dbfilesize.description: Target size of files within databases, in MiB

debuglogfile.title: Debug Log File
debuglogfile.description: Specify location of debug log file. Relative paths will be prefixed by a net-specific datadir location. Use nodebuglogfile to disable writing the log to a file
debuglogfile.shortDescription: Specify location of debug log file

loadblock.title: Import Blocks From File
loadblock.description: Import blocks from external blk000??.dat file on startup. This option can be set multiple times with different file values
loadblock.shortDescription: Import blocks from external blk000??.dat file on startup

lowmem.title: Low Memory
lowmem.description: If system available memory falls below <n> MiB, flush caches (0 to disable)
lowmem.shortDescription: If system available memory falls below <n> MiB, flush caches

maxmempool.title: Max Mempool Size
maxmempool.description: Keep the transaction memory pool below <n> megabytes

maxorphantx.title: Max Orphan Transactions
maxorphantx.description: Keep at most <n> unconnectable transactions in memory

mempoolexpiry.title: Mempool Expiration
mempoolexpiry.description: Do not keep transactions in the mempool longer than <n> hours

minimumchainwork.title: Minimum Chain Work
minimumchainwork.description: Minimum work assumed to exist on a valid chain in hex

nodebuglogfile.title: No Debug Log File
nodebuglogfile.description: Disable writing the debug log to a file

par.title: Script Verification Parallelization
par.description: Set the number of script verification threads (0 = automatic, up to 15, less than 0 = leave that many cores free)
par.shortDescription: Set the number of script verification threads

persistmempool.title: Persist Mempool
persistmempool.description: Whether to save the mempool on shutdown and load on restart

persistmempoolv1.title: Persist Mempool v1
persistmempoolv1.description: Whether a mempool.dat file created by persistmempool or the savemempool RPC will be written in the legacy format (version 1) or the current format (version 2). This temporary option will be removed in the future
persistmempoolv1.shortDescription: Whether mempool.dat file created by -persistmempool or the savemempool RPC is written in legacy (v1) or current (v2) format

pid.title: PID File
pid.description: Specify process ID file name. Relative paths will be prefixed by a net-specific datadir location

prune.title: Prune Blocks
prune.description: Reduce storage requirements by enabling pruning (deleting) of old blocks. This allows the pruneblockchain RPC to be called to delete specific blocks and enables automatic pruning of old blocks if a target size in MiB is provided. This mode is incompatible with txindex and coinstatsindex. WARNING: Reverting this setting requires re-downloading the entire blockchain. (0 = disable pruning blocks, 1 = allow manual pruning via RPC, greater or equal 550 = automatically prune blocks to stay under target size in MiB)

pruneduringinit.title: Prune Blocks During Init
pruneduringinit.description: Temporarily adjust the prune setting until initial sync completes. Ignored if pruning is disabled. (-1 = same value as prune)
pruneduringinit.shortDescription: Temporarily adjust the -prune setting until initial sync completes

reindex.title: Reindex
reindex.description: If enabled, wipe chain state and block index, and rebuild them from blk*.dat files on disk. Also wipe and rebuild other optional indexes that are active. If an assumeutxo snapshot was loaded, its chainstate will be wiped as well. The snapshot can then be reloaded via RPC. Setting this to auto automatically reindexes the block database if it is corrupted
reindex.shortDescription: Wipe chain state and block index, and rebuild them from blk*.dat files

reindex-chainstate.title: Reindex Chainstate
reindex-chainstate.description: If enabled, wipe chain state, and rebuild it from blk*.dat files on disk. If an assumeutxo snapshot was loaded, its chainstate will be wiped as well. The snapshot can then be reloaded via RPC
reindex-chainstate.shortDescription: Wipe chain state and rebuild it from blk*.dat files

settings.title: Settings File
settings.description: Specify path to dynamic settings data file. Can be disabled with nosettings. File is written at runtime and not meant to be edited by users (use bitcoin.conf instead for custom settings). Relative paths will be prefixed by datadir location
settings.shortDescription: Specify path to dynamic settings data file

shutdownnotify.title: Shutdown Notification
shutdownnotify.description: Execute command immediately before beginning shutdown. The need for shutdown may be urgent, so be careful not to delay it long (if the command doesn't require interaction with the server, consider having it fork into the background)
shutdownnotify.shortDescription: Execute command immediately before beginning shutdown

softwareexpiry.title: Software Expiry
softwareexpiry.description: Stop working after this POSIX timestamp. (0 = disable)
softwareexpiry.shortDescription: Stop working after this POSIX timestamp

txindex.title: Index Transactions
txindex.description: Maintain a full transaction index, used by the getrawtransaction rpc call

chain.title: Chain
chain.description: Choose which network / blockchain to use

regtest.title: Use Regtest
regtest.description: Enter regression test mode, which uses a special chain in which blocks can be solved instantly. This is intended for regression testing tools and app development. Equivalent to chain=regtest

signet.title: Use Signet
signet.description: Use the signet chain. Equivalent to chain=signet. Note that the network is defined by the signetchallenge parameter

signetblocktime.title: Signet Blocktime
signetblocktime.description: Difficulty adjustment will target a block time of the given amount in seconds (only for custom signet networks, must have signetchallenge set
signetblocktime.shortDescription: Difficulty adjustment will target block time of given amount in secs

signetchallenge.title: Signet Challenge
signetchallenge.description: Blocks must satisfy the given script to be considered valid (only for signet networks; defaults to the global default signet test network challenge)
signetchallenge.shortDescription: Blocks must satisfy the given script to be considered valid

signetseednode.title: Signet Seed Node
signetseednode.description: Specify a seed node for the signet network, in the hostname[:port] format, e.g. sig.net:1234 (may be used multiple times to specify multiple seed nodes; defaults to the global default signet test network seed node(s))
signetseednode.shortDescription: Specify seed node for the signet network

testnet.title: Use Testnet
testnet.description: Use the testnet3 chain. Equivalent to chain=test. Support for testnet3 is deprecated and will be removed in an upcoming release. Consider moving to testnet4 now by using testnet4

testnet4.title: Use Testnet 4
testnet4.description: Use the testnet4 chain. Equivalent to chain=testnet4

vbparams.title: Version Bits Deployment Params
vbparams.description: Use given start/end times for specified version bits deployment. Format: <deployment:start:end[:min_activation_height]>. Can be set multiple times. (regtest-only)
vbparams.shortDescription: Use given start/end times for specified version bits deployment

title: Networking
description: How your node interacts with other peers on the network

addnode.title: Connect to Peer
addnode.description: Add a node IP address to connect to and attempt to keep the connection open. This option can be set multiple times to add multiple nodes. Connections are limited to 8 at a time and are counted separately from the maxconnections limit
addnode.shortDescription: Add a node IP address to connect to and attempt to keep the connection open

asmap.title: ASN Mapping
asmap.description: Specify asn mapping used for bucketing of the peers. Relative paths will be prefixed by the net-specific datadir location
asmap.shortDescription: Specify asn mapping used for bucketing of the peers

bantime.title: Peer Ban Time
bantime.description: Default duration (in seconds) of manually configured bans

bind.title: Bind to IP Address
bind.description: Bind to given address and always listen on it. Use [host]:port notation for IPv6. Append =onion to tag any incoming connections to that address and port as incoming Tor connections
bind.shortDescription: Bind to given address and always listen on it

cjdnsreachable.title: CJDNS Reachable
cjdnsreachable.description: If set, then this host is configured for CJDNS (connecting to fc00::/8 addresses would lead us to the CJDNS network)
cjdnsreachable.shortDescription: If set, then this host is configured for CJDNS

connect.title: Only Connect to Peer
connect.description: Connect only to the specified node, noconnect disables automatic connections (the rules for this peer are the same as for addnode). This option can be specified multiple times to connect to multiple nodes
connect.shortDescription: Connect only to the specified node

discover.title: Discover IP Address
discover.description: Discover own IP addresses (default: 1 when listening and no externalip or proxy)

dns.title: Allow DNS Lookups
dns.description: Allow DNS lookups for addnode, seednode and connect

dnsseed.title: Use DNS Seed
dnsseed.description: Query for peer addresses via DNS lookup, if low on addresses (default: 1 unless connect used or maxconnections=0)
dnsseed.shortDescription: Query for peer addresses via DNS lookup, if low on addresses

externalip.title: External IP Address
externalip.description: Specify your own public IP address

feefilter.title: Fee Filter
feefilter.description: Tell other nodes to filter invs to us by our mempool min fee

fixedseeds.title: Use Fixed Seeds
fixedseeds.description: Allow fixed seeds if DNS seeds don't provide peers

forcednsseed.title: Force DNS Seed
forcednsseed.description: Always query for peer addresses via DNS lookup

i2pacceptincoming.title: Accept Incoming I2P Connections
i2pacceptincoming.description: Whether to accept inbound I2P connections. Ignored if i2psam is not set. Listening for incoming I2P connections is done through the SAM proxy, not by binding to a local address and port
i2pacceptincoming.shortDescription: Whether to accept inbound I2P connections

i2psam.title: I2P SAM Proxy
i2psam.description: I2P SAM proxy <ip:port> to reach I2P peers and accept I2P connections

listen.title: Listen for Incoming Connections
listen.description: Accept connections from outside (default: 1 if no proxy, connect or maxconnections=0)

maxconnections.title: Max Peer Connections
maxconnections.description: Maintain at most <n> automatic connections to peers. This limit does not apply to connections manually added via addnode or the addnode RPC, which have a separate limit of 8

maxuploadtarget.title: Max Upload Target
maxuploadtarget.description: Tries to keep outbound traffic under the given target per 24h. Limit does not apply to peers with 'download' permission or blocks created within past week. 0 = no limit. Optional suffix units [k|K|m|M|g|G|t|T] (default: M). Lowercase is 1000 base while uppercase is 1024 base
maxuploadtarget.shortDescription: Tries to keep outbound traffic under the given target per 24h

natpmp.title: NAT Port Mapping Protocol
natpmp.description: Use NAT-PMP to map the listening port

networkactive.title: Network Active
networkactive.description: Enable all P2P network activity. Can be changed by the setnetworkactive RPC command

noonion.title: No Tor Proxy
noonion.description: Disable connecting through separate SOCKS5 proxy <ip:port|path> to reach peers via Tor hidden services
noonion.shortDescription: Disable connecting to Tor hidden services

onion.title: Tor Proxy
onion.description: Use separate SOCKS5 proxy <ip:port|path> to reach peers via Tor hidden services. Set noonion to disable (default: proxy). May be a local file path prefixed with 'unix:'
onion.shortDescription: Use separate SOCKS5 proxy <ip:port|path> to reach peers via Tor hidden services

onlynet.title: Only Use Specific Network
onlynet.description: Make automatic outbound connections only to the selected network. Inbound and manual connections are not affected by this option. It can be specified multiple times to allow multiple networks
onlynet.shortDescription: Make automatic outbound connections only to the selected network

peerblockfilters.title: Peer Block Filters
peerblockfilters.description: Serve compact block filters to peers per BIP 157. NOTE: enabling this will force blockfilterindex on
peerblockfilters.shortDescription: Serve compact block filters to peers

peerbloomfilters.title: Peer Bloom Filters
peerbloomfilters.description: Support filtering of blocks and transaction with bloom filters

peertimeout.title: Peer Timeout
peertimeout.description: Specify a p2p connection timeout delay in seconds. After connecting to a peer, wait this amount of time before considering disconnection based on inactivity
peertimeout.shortDescription: Specify a p2p connection timeout delay in seconds

port.title: Listen Port
port.description: Listen for incoming connections on non-default port. Not relevant for I2P (see doc/i2p.md). If set to a value x, the default onion listening port will be set to x+1
port.shortDescription: Listen for incoming connections on non-default port

proxy.title: Proxy Connection
proxy.description: Connect through <ip:port|path> SOCKS5 proxy, set noproxy to disable. May be a local file path prefixed with 'unix:' if the proxy supports it

proxyrandomize.title: Randomize Proxy
proxyrandomize.description: Randomize credentials for every proxy connection. This enables Tor stream isolation
proxyrandomize.shortDescription: Randomize credentials for every proxy connection

seednode.title: Seed Node
seednode.description: Connect to a node (IP address) to retrieve peer addresses, then disconnect. This option can be specified multiple times to connect to multiple nodes. During startup, seed nodes will be tried before dnsseeds
seednode.shortDescription: Connect to a node (IP address) to retrieve peer addresses, then disconnect

timeout.title: Connection Timeout
timeout.description: Initial peer connection timeout in milliseconds. If an initial attempt to connect is unsuccessful after this amount of time, drop it
timeout.shortDescription: Initial peer connection timeout in milliseconds

torcontrol.title: Tor Control
torcontrol.description: Tor control  <ip:port> to use if onion listening enabled. If no port is specified, the default port of 9051 will be used
torcontrol.shortDescription: Tor control <ip:port> to use if onion listening enabled

uaappend.title: User Agent Append
uaappend.description: Append literal to the user agent string (should only be used for software embedding)
uaappend.shortDescription: Append literal to the user agent string

upnp.title: Transaction Reconciliation
upnp.description: Use UPnP to map the listening port

v2onlyclearnet.title: v2 Only Clearnet
v2onlyclearnet.description: Disallow outbound v1 connections on IPV4/IPV6. Enable this option only if you really need it. Use listen=0 to disable inbound connections since they can be unencrypted
v2onlyclearnet.shortDescription: Disallow outbound v1 connections on IPV4/IPV6

whitebind.title: Whitelist Bound IP Address
whitebind.description:
Bind to the given address and add permission flags <[permissions@]addr> to the peers connecting to it. Use [host]:port notation for IPv6. Allowed permissions:

bloomfilter
allow requesting BIP37 filtered blocks and transactions

blockfilters
serve compact block filters to peers per BIP157

noban
do not ban for misbehavior; implies download

forcerelay
relay transactions that are already in the mempool; implies relay

relay
relay even in blocksonly mode, and unlimited transaction announcements

mempool
allow requesting BIP35 mempool contents

download
allow getheaders during IBD, no disconnect after maxuploadtarget limit

addr
responses to GETADDR avoid hitting the cache and contain random records with the most up-to-date info

forceinbound
when connections are full, attempt to evict a random unprotected inbound peer to open a slot; implies noban

Specify multiple permissions separated by commas (default: download,noban,mempool,relay). Can be specified multiple times
whitebind.shortDescription: Bind to the given address and add permission flags to the peers connecting to it

whitelist.title: Whitelist Peer
whitelist.description: Add permission flags <[permissions@]IP address or network> to the peers using the given IP address (e.g. 1.2.3.4) or CIDR-notated network (e.g. 1.2.3.0/24). Uses the same permissions as whitebind. Additional flags "in" and "out" control whether permissions apply to incoming connections and/or outgoing (default: incoming only). Can be specified multiple times
whitelist.shortDescription: Add permission flags to the peers using the given IP address

title: Mempool
description: What transactions your node will relay to peers

acceptnonstddatacarrier.title: Accept Non-Standard Datacarrier Transactions
acceptnonstddatacarrier.description: Relay and mine non-OP_RETURN datacarrier injection

bytespersigop.title: Bytes Per Signature Operation
bytespersigop.description: Equivalent bytes per sigop in transactions for relay and mining

bytespersigopstrict.title: Bytes Per Signature Operation Strict
bytespersigopstrict.description: Minimum bytes per sigop in transactions we relay and mine

datacarrier.title: Data Carrier
datacarrier.description: Relay and mine data carrier transactions

datacarriercost.title: Data Carrier Cost
datacarriercost.description: Treat extra data in transactions as at least n vbytes per actual byte

datacarrierfullcount.title: Data Carrier Full Count
datacarrierfullcount.description: Apply datacarriersize limit to all known datacarrier methods

datacarriersize.title: Data Carrier Size
datacarriersize.description: Maximum size of data in data carrier transactions we relay and mine, in bytes

dustdynamic.title: Dynamic Dust Relay Fee
dustdynamic.description: Automatically raise dustrelayfee based on either the expected fee to be mined within <blocks> blocks, or to be within the best <kvB> kvB of this node's mempool. Specify in format: off|[<multiplier>*]target:<blocks>|[<multiplier>*]mempool:<kvB>. If unspecified, multiplier is 3

dustrelayfee.title: Dust Relay Fee
dustrelayfee.description: Fee rate (in BTC/kvB) used to define dust, the value of an output such that it will cost more than its value in fees at this fee rate to spend it
dustrelayfee.shortDescription: Fee rate (in BTC/kvB) used to define dust

incrementalrelayfee.title: Incremental Relay Fee
incrementalrelayfee.description: Fee rate (in BTC/kB) used to define cost of relay, used for mempool limiting and replacement policy
incrementalrelayfee.shortDescription: Fee rate (in BTC/kB) used to define cost of relay

maxscriptsize.title: Maximum Script Size
maxscriptsize.description: Maximum size of scripts we relay and mine, in bytes

mempoolfullrbf.title: Mempool Full RBF
mempoolfullrbf.description: Accept transaction replace-by-fee without requiring replaceability signaling

mempoolreplacement.title: Mempool Replacement
mempoolreplacement.description: Mempool RBF policy. Set "fee,optin" to honour RBF opt-out  signal, or "fee,-optin" to always RBF aka full RBF

mempooltruc.title: Mempool Topologically Restricted Until Confirmation (TRUC) Policy
mempooltruc.description: Behaviour for transactions requesting TRUC limits: "reject" the transactions entirely, "accept" them just like any other, or "enforce" to impose their requested restrictions
mempooltruc.shortDescription: Behaviour for transactions requesting TRUC limits

minrelaytxfee.title: Minimum Transaction Relay Fee
minrelaytxfee.description: Fees (in BTC/kvB) smaller than this are considered zero fee for relaying, mining and transaction creation
minrelaytxfee.shortDescription: Fees (in BTC/kvB) smaller than this are considered zero fee

permitbaremultisig.title: Permit Bare Multisig
permitbaremultisig.description: Relay transactions creating non-P2SH multisig outputs

rejectparasites.title: Reject Parasites
rejectparasites.description: Refuse to relay or mine parasitic overlay protocols

rejecttokens.title: Reject Tokens
rejecttokens.description: Refuse to relay or mine transactions involving non-bitcoin tokens

spkreuse.title: Script And Public Key Reuse
spkreuse.description: Set to "allow" to relay/mine transactions reusing addresses or other pubkey scripts, or "conflict" to treat them as exclusive prior to being mined
spkreuse.shortDescription: Whether to relay/mine txs reusing addresses or other pubkey scripts

whitelistforcerelay.title: Whitelist Force Relay
whitelistforcerelay.description: Add 'forcerelay' permission to whitelisted peers with default permissions. This will relay transactions even if the transactions were already in the mempool
whitelistforcerelay.shortDescription: Add 'forcerelay' permission to whitelisted peers with default permissions

whitelistrelay.title: Whitelist Relay
whitelistrelay.description: Add 'relay' permission to whitelisted peers with default permissions. This will accept relayed transactions even when not relaying transactions
whitelistrelay.shortDescription: Add 'relay' permission to whitelisted peers with default permissions

title: Mining
description: Attributes of blocks that can be mined by your node

blockmaxsize.title: Max Block Size
blockmaxsize.description: Set maximum block size in bytes

blockmintxfee.title: Block Min Transaction Fee
blockmintxfee.description: Set lowest fee rate (in BTC/kB) for transactions to be included in block creation
blockmintxfee.shortDescription: Set lowest fee rate (in BTC/kB) for tx inclusion in block creation

blockprioritysize.title: Block Priority Size
blockprioritysize.description: Set maximum size of high-priority/low-fee transactions in bytes

blockversion.title: Block Version
blockversion.description: Override block version to test forking scenarios

title: RPC
description: Security and performance options for accessing your node's RPC interface

rpcallowip.title: RPC Allow IP Address
rpcallowip.description: Allow JSON-RPC connections from specified source. Valid are a single IP (e.g. 1.2.3.4), a network/netmask (e.g. 1.2.3.4/255.255.255.0) a network/CIDR (e.g. 1.2.3.4/24), all ipv4 (0.0.0.0/0), or all ipv6 (::/0).. This option can be specified multiple times
rpcallowip.shortDescription: Allow JSON-RPC connections from specified source

rpcauth.title: RPC Authentication
rpcauth.description: Username and HMAC-SHA-256 hashed password for JSON-RPC connections, to be provided in the format: <userpw>[:wallet]. The field <userpw> comes in the format: <USERNAME>:<SALT>$<HASH>. A canonical python script is included in share/rpcauth. The client then connects normally using the rpcuser=<USERNAME>/rpcpassword=<PASSWORD> pair of arguments. A single wallet name can also be specified to restrict access to only that wallet, or '-' to deny all wallet access. This option can be specified multiple times
rpcauth.shortDescription: Username and HMAC-SHA-256 hashed password for JSON-RPC connections

rpcauthfile.title: RPC Authentication File
rpcauthfile.description: A file with a single line with the same format as rpcauth. This option can be specified multiple times
rpcauthfile.shortDescription: A file with a single line with the same format as rpcauth

rpcbind.title: Bind RPC Address
rpcbind.description: Bind to given address to listen for JSON-RPC connections. Do not expose the RPC server to untrusted networks such as the public internet! This option is ignored unless rpcallowip is also passed. Port is optional and overrides rpcport. Use [host]:port notation for IPv6. This option can be specified multiple times
rpcbind.shortDescription: Bind to given address to listen for JSON-RPC connections

rpccookiefile.title: RPC Cookie File
rpccookiefile.description: Location of the RPC auth cookie. Relative paths will be prefixed by a net-specific datadir location
rpccookiefile.shortDescription: Location of the RPC auth cookie

rpccookieperms.title: RPC Cookie Permissions
rpccookieperms.description: Set the permissions on the RPC auth cookie file so that it is readable by [owner|group|all]
rpccookieperms.shortDescription: Set the permissions on the RPC auth cookie file

rpcdoccheck.title: RPC Documentation Check
rpcdoccheck.description: Throw a non-fatal error at runtime if the documentation for an RPC is incorrect
rpcdoccheck.shortDescription: Throw non-fatal error at runtime if docs for an RPC are incorrect

rpcport.title: RPC Port
rpcport.description: Listen for JSON-RPC connections on this port

rpcservertimeout.title: RPC Server Timeout
rpcservertimeout.description: Number of seconds after which an uncompleted RPC call will time out

rpcthreads.title: RPC Threads
rpcthreads.description: Number of threads to service RPC calls

rpcwhitelist.title: RPC Whitelist
rpcwhitelist.description: Set a whitelist to filter incoming RPC calls for a specific user. To be specified in the format: <USERNAME>:<rpc 1>,<rpc 2>,...,<rpc n>. This option can be specified multiple times. If multiple whitelists are set for a given user, they are set-intersected. See rpcwhitelistdefault documentation for information on default whitelist behavior
rpcwhitelist.shortDescription: Set a whitelist to filter incoming RPC calls for a specific user

rpcwhitelistdefault.title: RPC Whitelist Default
rpcwhitelistdefault.description: Sets default behavior for rpc whitelisting. Unless set to 0, if any rpcwhitelist is set, the rpc server acts as if all rpc users are subject to empty-unless-otherwise-specified whitelists. If set to 1 and no rpcwhitelist is set, rpc server acts as if all rpc users are subject to empty whitelists
rpcwhitelistdefault.shortDescription: Sets default behavior for rpc whitelisting

rpcworkqueue.title: RPC Work Queue Size
rpcworkqueue.description: The depth of the work queue to service RPC calls

server.title: Enable RPC Server
server.description: Accept command line and JSON-RPC commands

addresstype.title: Address Type
addresstype.description: What type of addresses to use

avoidpartialspends.title: Avoid Partial Spends
avoidpartialspends.description: Group outputs by address, selecting many (possibly all) or none, instead of selecting on a per-output basis. Privacy is improved as addresses are mostly swept with fewer transactions and outputs are aggregated in clean change addresses. It may result in higher fees due to less optimal coin selection caused by this added limitation and possibly a larger-than-necessary number of inputs being used. Always enabled for wallets with "avoid_reuse" enabled, otherwise default: 0
avoidpartialspends.shortDescription: Group outputs by address, selecting many (possibly all) or none, instead of selecting on a per-output basis

changetype.title: Change Address Type
changetype.description: What type of change address to use. Default is "legacy" when addresstype=legacy, else it is an implementation detail
changetype.shortDescription: What type of change address to use

consolidatefeerate.title: Consolidation Fee Rate
consolidatefeerate.description: The maximum feerate (in BTC/kvB) at which transaction building may use more inputs than strictly necessary so that the wallet's UTXO pool can be reduced
consolidatefeerate.shortDescription: Maximum feerate (in BTC/kvB) at which transactions may use more inputs

dblogsize.title: DB Log Size
dblogsize.description: Flush wallet database activity from memory to disk log every <n> megabytes

disablewallet.title: Disable Wallet
disablewallet.description: Do not load the wallet and disable wallet RPC calls

discardfee.title: Discard Change Fee
discardfee.description: The fee rate (in BTC/kB) that indicates your tolerance for discarding change by adding it to the fee. Note: An output is discarded if it is dust at this rate, but we will always discard up to the dust relay fee and a discard fee above that is limited by the fee estimate for the longest target
discardfee.shortDescription: Fee rate (in BTC/kB) that indicates tolerance for discarding change by adding it to the fee

fallbackfee.title: Fallback Transaction Fee
fallbackfee.description: A fee rate (in BTC/kB) that will be used when fee estimation has insufficient data. Set to 0 to entirely disable the fallbackfee feature
fallbackfee.shortDescription: Fee rate (in BTC/kB) that will be used when fee estimation has insufficient data

flushwallet.title: Flush Wallet Automatically
flushwallet.description: Run a thread to flush wallet periodically

keypool.title: Key Pool Size
keypool.description: Set key pool size. Warning: Smaller sizes may increase the risk of losing funds when restoring from an old backup, if none of the addresses in the original keypool have been used

maxapsfee.title: Max Avoid Partial Spend Fee
maxapsfee.description: Spend up to this amount in additional (absolute) fees (in BTC) if it allows the use of partial spend avoidance
maxapsfee.shortDescription: Spend up to this amount in additional (absolute) fees (in BTC) to avoid partial spends

mintxfee.title: Minimum Transaction Fee
mintxfee.description: Fee rates (in BTC/kB) smaller than this are considered zero fee for transaction creation
mintxfee.shortDescription: Fee rates (in BTC/kB) smaller than this are considered zero for tx creation

paytxfee.title: Pay Transaction Fee
paytxfee.description: Fee rate (in BTC/kvB) to add to transactions you send

privdb.title: Private DB
privdb.description: Set the DB_PRIVATE flag in the wallet db environment

spendzeroconfchange.title: Spend Unconfirmed Change
spendzeroconfchange.description: Spend unconfirmed change when sending transactions

swapbdbendian.title: Swap DB Endianness
swapbdbendian.description: Swaps the internal endianness of BDB wallet databases

txconfirmtarget.title: Transaction Fee Confirmation Target
txconfirmtarget.description: If paytxfee is not set, include enough fee so that transactions begin confirmation on average within <n> blocks
txconfirmtarget.shortDescription: If paytxfee not set, add fee so txs begin confirmation on avg within <n> blocks

unsafesqlitesync.title: Unsafe SQL Lite Sync
unsafesqlitesync.description: Set SQLite synchronous=OFF to disable waiting for the database to sync to disk. This is unsafe and can cause data loss and corruption. This option is only used by tests to improve their performance
unsafesqlitesync.shortDescription: Set SQLite synchronous=OFF to disable waiting for database to sync to disk

wallet.title: Wallet Path
wallet.description: Specify wallet path to load at startup. Can be used multiple times to load multiple wallets. Path is to a directory containing wallet data and log files. If the path is not absolute, it is interpreted relative to walletdir. This only loads existing wallets and does not create new ones. For backwards compatibility this also accepts names of existing top-level data files in walletdir
wallet.shortDescription: Specify wallet path to load at startup

walletcrosschain.title: Wallet Cross Chain
walletcrosschain.description: Allow reusing wallet files across chains

walletdir.title: Wallet Directory Location
walletdir.description: Specify directory to hold wallets (default: <datadir>/wallets if it exists, otherwise <datadir>)

walletimplicitsegwit.title: Wallet Implicit Segwit
walletimplicitsegwit.description: Support segwit when restoring wallet backups and importing keys

walletnotify.title: Wallet Notification
walletnotify.description: Execute command when a wallet transaction changes. %s in cmd is replaced by TxID, %w is replaced by wallet name, %b is replaced by the hash of the block including the transaction (set to 'unconfirmed' if the transaction is not included) and %h is replaced by the block height (-1 if not included). %w should NOT be quoted because this would break shell escaping used to invoke the command
walletnotify.shortDescription: Execute command when a wallet transaction changes

walletrbf.title: Enable Replace By Fee Transactions
walletrbf.description: Send transactions with full-RBF opt-in enabled (RPC only)

walletrejectlongchains.title: Reject Long Transaction Chains
walletrejectlongchains.description: Wallet will not create transactions that violate mempool chain limits

title: ZeroMQ
description: Options for handling notifications emitted via ZeroMQ

zmqpubhashblock.title: Publish Block Hashes
zmqpubhashblock.description: Enable publishing of block hashes to <address>
zmqpubhashblock.shortDescription: Enable publishing of block hashes to <address>

zmqpubhashblockhwm.title: Publish Block Hashes High Water Mark
zmqpubhashblockhwm.description: Set publish hash block outbound message high water mark

zmqpubhashtx.title: Publish Transaction Hashes
zmqpubhashtx.description: Enable publishing of transaction hashes to <address>
zmqpubhashtx.shortDescription: Enable publishing of transaction hashes to <address>

zmqpubhashtxhwm.title: Publish Transaction Hashes High Water Mark
zmqpubhashtxhwm.description: Set publish hash transaction outbound message high water mark

zmqpubhashwallettx.title: Publish Wallet Transaction Hashes
zmqpubhashwallettx.description: Enable publishing of wallet transaction hashes to <address>
zmqpubhashwallettx.shortDescription: Enable publishing of wallet transaction hashes to <address>

zmqpubhashwallettxhwm.title: Publish Wallet Transaction Hashes High Water Mark
zmqpubhashwallettxhwm.description: Set publish hash wallet transaction outbound message high water mark

zmqpubrawblock.title: Publish Raw Blocks
zmqpubrawblock.description: Enable publishing of raw block hex to <address>
zmqpubrawblock.shortDescription: Enable publishing of raw block hex to <address>

zmqpubrawblockhwm.title: Publish Raw Blocks High Water Mark
zmqpubrawblockhwm.description: Set publish raw block outbound message high water mark

zmqpubrawtx.title: Publish Raw Transactions
zmqpubrawtx.description: Enable publishing of raw transaction hex to <address>
zmqpubrawtx.shortDescription: Enable publishing of raw transaction hex to <address>

zmqpubrawtxhwm.title: Publish Wallet Transaction Hashes High Water Mark
zmqpubrawtxhwm.description: Set publish raw transaction outbound message high water mark

zmqpubrawwallettx.title: Publish Raw Wallet Transaction
zmqpubrawwallettx.description: Enable publishing of raw wallet transaction hex to <address>
zmqpubrawwallettx.shortDescription: Enable publishing of raw wallet transaction hex to <address>

zmqpubrawwallettxhwm.title: Publish Raw Wallet Transactions High Water Mark
zmqpubrawwallettxhwm.description: Set publish raw wallet transaction outbound message high water mark

zmqpubsequence.title: Publish Hash Block and Transaction Sequence
zmqpubsequence.description: Enable publish hash block and tx sequence in <address>
zmqpubsequence.shortDescription: Enable publish hash block and tx sequence in <address>

zmqpubsequencehwm.title: Publish Hash Sequence Message High Water Mark
zmqpubsequencehwm.description: Set publish hash sequence message high water mark

statsmaxmemorytarget.title: Statistics Maximum Memory Target
statsmaxmemorytarget.description: Set the memory limit target for statistics in bytes

acceptstalefeeestimates.title: Accept Stale Fee Estimates
acceptstalefeeestimates.description: Read fee estimates even if they are stale (regtest only) fee estimates are considered stale if they are 60 hours old
acceptstalefeeestimates.shortDescription: Read fee estimates even if they are stale (regtest only)

capturemessages.title: Capture Messages
capturemessages.description: Capture all P2P messages to disk

checkaddrman.title: Check Address Manager
checkaddrman.description: Run addrman consistency checks every n operations. Use 0 to disable
checkaddrman.shortDescription: Run addrman consistency checks every n operations

checkblockindex.title: Check Block Index
checkblockindex.description: Do a consistency check for the block tree, chainstate, and other validation data structures every n operations. Use 0 to disable. (default: 0, regtest: 1)
checkblockindex.shortDescription: Do consistency check for block tree, chainstate, and other validation data structures every n ops

checkblocks.title: Check Blocks
checkblocks.description: How many blocks to check at startup (0 = all)

checklevel.title: Check Block Index
checklevel.description:
How thorough the block verification of checkblocks is:

level 0
reads the blocks from disk

level 1
verifies block validity

level 2
verifies undo data

level 3
checks disconnection of tip blocks

level 4
tries to reconnect the blocks

Each level includes the checks of the previous levels
checklevel.shortDescription: How thorough the block verification of -checkblocks is

checkmempool.title: Check Mempool
checkmempool.description: Run mempool consistency checks every n transactions. Use 0 to disable (default: 0, regtest: 1)
checkmempool.shortDescription: Run mempool consistency checks every n transactions

checkpoints.title: Enable Checkpoints
checkpoints.description: Enable rejection of any forks from the known historical chain until block 885248
checkpoints.shortDescription: Reject forks from the known historical chain until block 885248

debug.title: Debug Logging
debug.description: Output debug and trace logging. If set to 1 or "all", output for all categories. If set to 0 or "none", disable for all previously set categories. This option can be specified multiple times to output multiple categories

debugexclude.title: Exclude Debug Logging
debugexclude.description: Exclude debug and trace logging for a category. Can be used in conjunction with debug=all to output debug and trace logging for all categories except the specified category. This option can be specified multiple times to exclude multiple categories. This takes priority over debug
debugexclude.shortDescription: Exclude debug and trace logging for a category

deprecatedrpc.title: Enable Deprecated RPC Commands
deprecatedrpc.description: Allows deprecated RPC method(s) to be used. The release notes of each new major release come with detailed instructions on what RPC features were deprecated and how to re-enable them temporarily. This option can be set multiple times
deprecatedrpc.shortDescription: Allows deprecated RPC method(s) to be used

fastprune.title: Fast Prune
fastprune.description: Use smaller block files and lower minimum prune height for testing purposes

limitancestorcount.title: Limit Transaction Ancestor Count
limitancestorcount.description: Do not accept transactions if number of in-mempool ancestors is n or more
limitancestorcount.shortDescription: Reject txs if number of in-mempool ancestors is n or more

limitancestorsize.title: Limit Transaction Ancestor Size
limitancestorsize.description: Do not accept transactions whose size with all in-mempool ancestors exceeds n kilobytes
limitancestorsize.shortDescription: Reject txs whose size with all in-mempool ancestors exceeds n kB

limitdescendantcount.title: Limit Transaction Descendant Count
limitdescendantcount.description: Do not accept transactions if any ancestor would have n or more in-mempool descendants
limitdescendantcount.shortDescription: Reject txs if any ancestor would have n or more in-mempool descendants

limitdescendantsize.title: Limit Transaction Descendant Size
limitdescendantsize.description: Do not accept transactions if any ancestor would have more than n kilobytes of in-mempool descendants
limitdescendantsize.shortDescription: Reject txs if any ancestor would have more than n kB of in-mempool descendants

logips.title: Log IP Addresses
logips.description: Include IP addresses in debug output

loglevel.title: Log Level
loglevel.description:
Set the global or per-category severity level for logging categories enabled with the debug configuration option or the logging RPC.

Possible values are:
info, debug, trace.

The following levels are always logged:
error, warning, info.

If <category>:<level> is supplied, the setting will override the global one and may be specified multiple times to set multiple category-specific levels.

<category> can be:
addrman, bench, blockstorage, cmpctblock, coindb, estimatefee, http, i2p, ipc, leveldb, libevent, mempool, mempoolrej, net, proxy, prune, qt, rand, reindex, rpc, scan, selectcoins, tor, txpackages, txreconciliation, validation, walletdb, zmq
loglevel.shortDescription: Set the global or per-category severity level for logging categories

loglevelalways.title: Log Level Always
loglevelalways.description: Always prepend a category and level

logsourcelocations.title: Log Source Locations
logsourcelocations.description: Prepend debug output with name of the originating source location (source file, line number and function name)
logsourcelocations.shortDescription: Prepend debug output with name of the originating source location

logthreadnames.title: Log Thread Names
logthreadnames.description: Prepend debug output with name of the originating thread

logtimemicros.title: Log Precise Timestamps
logtimemicros.description: Add microsecond precision to debug timestamps

maxsigcachesize.title: Max Signature Cache Size
maxsigcachesize.description: Limit sum of signature cache and script execution cache sizes to n MiB

maxtipage.title: Max Age of Chain Tip
maxtipage.description: Maximum tip age in seconds to consider node in initial block download

maxtxfee.title: Max Transaction Fee
maxtxfee.description: Maximum total fees (in BTC) to use in a single wallet transaction or raw transaction; setting this too low may abort large transactions
maxtxfee.shortDescription: Max total fees (in BTC) to use in a single wallet tx or raw tx

mocktime.title: Mock Timestamps
mocktime.description: Replace actual time with UNIX epoch time (0 = disable)

printpriority.title: Print Priority
printpriority.description: Log transaction priority and fee rate in BTC/kvB when mining blocks

printtoconsole.title: Print To Console
printtoconsole.description: Send trace/debug info to console (default: 1 when no daemon. To disable logging to file, set nodebuglogfile)

shrinkdebugfile.title: Shrink Debug Log File
shrinkdebugfile.description: Shrink debug.log file on client startup (default: 1 when no debug)
shrinkdebugfile.shortDescription: Shrink debug.log file on client startup

stopafterblockimport.title: Stop After Block Import
stopafterblockimport.description: Stop running after importing blocks from disk

stopatheight.title: Stop At Height
stopatheight.description: Stop running after reaching the given height in the main chain (0 = disable)

test.title: Test-Only Option
test.description: Pass a test-only option. Options include: addrman (use deterministic addrman)

testactivationheight.title: Test Activation Height
testactivationheight.description:
Set the activation height <name>@<height>

<name> can be:
segwit, bip34, dersig, cltv, csv

(regtest-only)

uacomment.title: User Agent Comment
uacomment.description: Append comment to the user agent string
